info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Graham and northeastern Cochise Counties through 645 PM MST... At 600 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northeast of Pearce-Sunsites, or 16 miles south of Willcox, moving west at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Willcox, Bowie, Chiricahua National Monument, Pearce-Sunsites, Cochise, San Simon and Kansas Settlement. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 331 and 381. Route 181 between mile markers 55 and 64. Route 186 between mile markers 327 and 359. Route 191 between mile markers 39 and 91. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
